sys:positions.organization: Congress Mukti Sena (Liberation Army) of Nepali Congress
sys:positions.title: Local Commander

sys:positions.organization: Queen's Gurkha Engineers Unit, British Army
sys:positions.title: Serjeant

description: Sukra Raj Sonyok Limbu (born 22 December 1936) is a Nepalese politician from the Limbu (Songyokpa) family in Taplejung. He served as a Member of the National Assembly of Nepal from 1997 to 2004, and was the Chief Whip of the Nepali Congress (Democratic) party from 2003 to 2004. A veteran of the British Gurkha Army, he served from 1954 to 1970 in the Queen's Gurkha Engineers Unit, reaching the rank of Serjeant. He was also an active participant in the 1974 arm uprising as a local commander for the Congress Mukti Sena.
short_description: Nepalese politician, former Member of Parliament, and former British Gurkha Army soldier.
